Issues and Recommendations with Multiple Stateful DHCPv6 Options
Abstract
contents.ja: 抽象

contents.text: The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol for IPv6 (DHCPv6) specification defined two stateful options, IA_NA and IA_TA, but did not anticipate the development of additional stateful options. DHCPv6 Prefix Delegation added the IA_PD option, which is stateful. Applications that use IA_NA and IA_PD together have revealed issues that need to be addressed. This document updates RFCs 3315 and 3633 to address these issues.

1. Introduction
contents.ja: 1. はじめに

contents.text: DHCPv6 [RFC3315] was written without the expectation that additional stateful DHCPv6 options would be developed. DHCPv6 Prefix Delegation [RFC3633] since added a new stateful option for Prefix Delegation to DHCPv6. Implementation experience of the Customer Edge (CE) router model described in [RFC7084] has shown issues with the DHCPv6 protocol in supporting multiple stateful option types, in particular IA_NA (non-temporary addresses) and IA_PD (delegated prefixes).
contents.ja: DHCPv6の[RFC3315]は、追加のステートフルDHCPv6オプションが開発されるだろうという期待せずに書かれました。 DHCPv6のプレフィックス委譲[RFC3633]のDHCPv6にプレフィックス委任のための新しいステートフルなオプションを追加しましたので、。 [RFC7084]で説明カスタマーエッジ（CE）ルータモデルの実装経験は、特定のIA_NA（非一時アドレス）とIA_PD（委任プレフィックス）で、複数のステートフルなオプションの種類をサポートしている中でのDHCPv6プロトコルの問題を示しています。

contents.text: This document describes a number of problems encountered with coexistence of the IA_NA and IA_PD option types and specifies changes to the DHCPv6 protocol to address these problems.
contents.ja: この文書では、IA_NAとIA_PDオプションの種類が共存して発生した問題の数について説明し、これらの問題に対処するためのDHCPv6プロトコルへの変更を指定します。

contents.text: The intention of this work is to clarify and, where needed, modify the DHCPv6 protocol specification to support IA_NA and IA_PD option types within a single DHCPv6 session.
contents.ja: この作品の意図は明確にし、必要な場合、単一のDHCPv6セッション内でIA_NAとIA_PDオプションの種類をサポートするために、DHCPv6のプロトコル仕様を変更することです。

contents.text: Note that while IA_TA (temporary addresses) options may be included with other IA option type requests, these generally are not renewed (there are no T1/T2 times) and have a separate life cycle from IA_NA and IA_PD option types. Therefore, the IA_TA option type is mostly out of scope for this document.
contents.ja: オプションは、他のIAオプションタイプのリクエストに含まれ得る（一時アドレス）ながらIA_TAが、これらは一般的にリニューアル（無T1 / T2時間は存在しない）とIA_NAとIA_PDオプションタイプから別のライフサイクルを持っていないことに注意してください。したがって、IA_TAオプションの種類は主にこの文書の範囲外です。

contents.text: The changes described in this document are intended to be incorporated in a new revision of the DHCPv6 protocol specification [DHCPv6].
contents.ja: 本書で説明する変更は、DHCPv6のプロトコル仕様[たDHCPv6]の新しい改訂版に組み込まれることが意図されています。

contents.text: 3. Terminology

contents.text: In addition to the terminology defined in [RFC3315], [RFC3633], and [RFC7227], the following terminology is used in this document:
contents.ja: [RFC3315]で定義される用語、[RFC3633]及び[RFC7227]に加えて、以下の用語は、この文書で使用されています。

contents.text: Identity Association (IA): Throughout this document, "IA" is used to refer to the Identity Association containing addresses or prefixes assigned to a client and carried in the IA_NA or IA_PD options, respectively.
contents.ja: アイデンティティ協会（IA）は：このドキュメントでは、「IA」は、それぞれ、クライアントに割り当てられたアドレスまたはプレフィックスを含むとIA_NAまたはIA_PDオプションで運ばれた識別情報の関連付けを参照するために使用されます。

contents.text: IA option types: This is used to generally mean an IA_NA and/or IA_PD option.
contents.ja: IAオプションの種類は：これは一般的にIA_NAおよび/またはIA_PDオプションを意味するために使用されます。

contents.text: Stateful options: Options that require a dynamic binding state per client on the server.
contents.ja: ステートフル・オプション：サーバー上のクライアントごとに動的結合状態を必要とするオプション。

contents.text: 4. Handling of Multiple IA Option Types
contents.ja: 複数のIAオプションの各種タイプの4取り扱いについて

contents.text: The DHCPv6 specification [RFC3315] was written with the assumption that the only stateful options were for assigning addresses. DHCPv6 Prefix Delegation [RFC3633] describes how to extend the DHCPv6 protocol to handle prefix delegation, but does not clearly specify how the DHCP address assignment and prefix delegation coexist.
contents.ja: DHCPv6の仕様[RFC3315]は唯一ステートフルオプションはアドレスを割り当てるためであったことを前提に書かれました。 DHCPv6のプレフィックス委譲[RFC3633]は、プレフィックス委任を処理するために、DHCPv6のプロトコルを拡張する方法について説明したが、明確にどのようにDHCPアドレスの割り当てとプレフィックス委任共存を指定していません。

contents.text: If a client requests multiple IA option types, but the server is configured to only offer a subset of them, the client could react in several ways:
contents.ja: クライアントが複数のIAオプションの種類を要求しますが、サーバはそれらのサブセットを提供するだけに設定されている場合、クライアントはいくつかの方法で反応することができます：

contents.text: 1. Reset the state machine and continue to send Solicit messages,
contents.ja: 、ステート・マシンをリセットし、要請メッセージを送信し続ける1

contents.text: 2. Create separate DHCP sessions for each IA option type and continue to Solicit for the unfulfilled IA options, or
contents.ja: 2.各IAオプションの種類の別のDHCPセッションを作成し、満たされていないIAオプションに勧誘し続ける、または

contents.text: 3. The client could continue with the single session and include the unfulfilled IA options in subsequent messages to the server.
contents.ja: 3.クライアントは、単一のセッションを継続し、サーバへのその後のメッセージで満たされていないIAオプションを含めることができます。

contents.text: Resetting the state machine and continuing to send Solicit messages may result in the client never completing DHCP and is generally not considered a good solution. It can also result in a packet storm if the client does not appropriately rate limit its sending of Solicit messages or if there are many clients on the network. Client implementors that follow this approach SHOULD implement the updates to RFC 3315 specified in [RFC7083].
contents.ja: ステート・マシンをリセットし、要請メッセージを送信し続け、クライアントがDHCPを完了したことがないと一般的に良い解決策とは見なされないことがあります。クライアントが適切にネットワーク上の多数のクライアントがある場合、その要請は、メッセージの送信またはレート制限しない場合にもパケットストームが発生することができます。このアプローチに従うクライアントの実装は、[RFC7083]で指定されたRFC 3315にアップデートを実装する必要があります。

contents.text: Creating a separate DHCP session (separate instances of the client state machine) per IA option type, while conceptually simple, causes a number of issues: additional host resources required to create and maintain multiple instances of the state machine in clients, additional DHCP protocol traffic, unnecessary duplication of other configuration options and the potential for conflict, and divergence in that each IA option type specification specifies its 'own' version of the DHCP protocol.

contents.text: The single session and state machine allows the client to use the best configuration it is able to obtain from a single DHCP server during the configuration exchange. Note, however, that the server may not be configured to deliver the entire configuration requested by the client. In that case, the client could continue to operate only using the configuration received, even if other servers can provide the missing configuration. In practice, especially in the case of handling IA_NA and IA_PD, this situation should be rare or a temporary operational error. So, it is more likely for the client to get all configuration if it continues, in each subsequent configuration exchange, to request all the configuration information it is programmed to try to obtain, including any stateful configuration options for which no results were returned in previous exchanges.

This document introduces some clarifications and small modifications to the current specifications to address these concerns.

contents.text: 4.1. Placement of Status Codes in an Advertise Message
contents.ja: 4.1. 広告メッセージでステータスコードの配置

contents.text: In Reply messages, IA-specific status codes (i.e., NoAddrsAvail, NotOnLink, NoBinding, and NoPrefixAvail) are encapsulated in the IA option. In Advertise messages though, the NoAddrsAvail code is returned at the top level. This makes sense if the client is only interested in the assignment of the addresses and the failure case is fatal. However, if the client sends both IA_NA and IA_PD options in a Solicit message, it is possible that the server will offer some prefixes but no addresses, and the client may choose to send a Request message to obtain the offered prefixes. In this case, it is better if the Status Code option for IA-specific status codes is encapsulated in the IA option to indicate that the failure occurred for the specific IA. This also makes the NoAddrsAvail and NoPrefixAvail Status Code option placement for Advertise messages identical to Reply messages.

contents.ja: 4.3.  T1 / T2の時間

contents.text: The T1 and T2 times determine when the client will contact the server to extend lifetimes of information received in an IA. How should a client handle the case where multiple IA options have different T1 and T2 times?

contents.text: In a multiple IA option type model, the T1/T2 times are protocol timers that should be independent of the IA options themselves. If we were to redo the DHCP protocol from scratch, the T1/T2 times should be carried in a separate DHCP option.

contents.text: 4.4. Renew and Rebind Messages

contents.text: 4.4.1. Renew Message
contents.ja: 4.4.1. メッセージを更新

contents.text: In multiple IA option type models, the client may include multiple IA options in the Request message, and the server may create bindings only for a subset of the IA options included by the client. For the IA options in the Request message for which the server does not create the bindings, the server sends the IA options in the Reply message with the NoAddrsAvail or NoPrefixAvail status codes.

The client that accepted the bindings created by the server will periodically send a Renew message to extend their lifetimes. However, the Renew message, as described in [RFC3315], does not support the ability for the client to extend the lifetimes of the bindings for some IAs, while requesting bindings for other IAs.

contents.text: 4.5. Confirm Message

contents.text: The Confirm message, as described in [RFC3315], is specific to address assignment. This message is sent when, e.g., the client has moved and needs to validate its addresses. Not all bindings can be validated by servers and the Confirm message provides for this by specifying that a server that is unable to determine the on-link status MUST NOT send a Reply.
